```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```

This function creates a new column `total_var` which holds the count of columns in the dataset

```{echo=True, include=FALSE}
# Define the function
total_var <- function(data) {
  data <- data %>% 
    mutate(total_var = ncol(.))
  return(data)
}

# Apply the function to the iris dataset (example)
total_var(iris)
```

This function creates a new column `total_row` which holds the count of rows in the dataset

```{echo=True, include=FALSE}
# Define new function
total_row <- function(data_new) {
  data_new <- data_new%>%
    mutate(total_row = nrow(.))  
}

# Apply the function to the iris dataset (following the example)
total_row(iris)
```
